main
Class Hub

java.lang.Object
  main.Hub

public class Hub
extends java.lang.Object

The main hub of the program. Serves to get references to all objects of interest (such as settings, main window, loaded resources, etc.) Plugins are encouraged to make use of these services.

Author:
Lenko Grigorov

Field Detail

persistentData

public static final PersistentProperties persistentData
Contains (key,value) pairs which are stored in the settings file (settings.ini). Accessible to everyone.

stringResource

private static java.util.ResourceBundle[] stringResource
The system-wide bundle with strings. Should be used for any messages and strings to appear in IDES (FIXME: save for the commmands which are managed by an external library?). The native IDES bundle occupies the first element of the array. Plugins register their own bundles with addResouceBundle(ResourceBundle); these bundles get added to the array. The strings are accessible through the string(String) method which scans all elements of the array. For examples of use, see storePersistentData().

See Also:
addResouceBundle(ResourceBundle), string(String)

mainWindow

private static javax.swing.JFrame mainWindow
The main window of the application.

See Also:
setMainWindow(JFrame)

Method Detail

string

public static java.lang.String string(java.lang.String key)
Gets from the resource bundle stringResource the string which corresponds to the given key. Should be used for any messages and strings to appear in IDES (FIXME: save for the commmands which are managed by an external library?).

Parameters:
key - lookup key for the string
Returns:
the string corresponding to the key
See Also:
stringResource

addResouceBundle

public static void addResouceBundle(java.util.ResourceBundle bundle)
Adds a string resource bundle to the set of bundles which are used to look up strings. Can be used by plugins to add their own string bundles at startup.

Parameters:
bundle - the string resource bundle to be added
See Also:
stringResource, string(String)

loadPersistentData

static void loadPersistentData()
                        throws java.io.IOException
Loads the settings from the file settings.ini into the list of settings persistentData.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
persistentData, storePersistentData()

storePersistentData

public static void storePersistentData()
Stores the settings from the list of settings persistentData into the file settings.ini. If this fails, it shows a message box to the user.

setMainWindow

static void setMainWindow(javax.swing.JFrame window)
Sets the main window (JFrame) of the application so that it is accessible to other parts of the software.

Parameters:
window - the main window

getMainWindow

public static javax.swing.JFrame getMainWindow()
Gets the main window of the application.

Returns:
the main window

registerOptionsPane

public static void registerOptionsPane(OptionsPane pane)
Register an options pane with the options dialog box. To be called just once per session (e.g., when loading IDES or a plugin).

Parameters:
pane - the OptionsPane that will be registered
See Also:
OptionsPane, OptionsWindow

openOptionsPane

public static void openOptionsPane(java.lang.String title)
Request that the options dialog box opens up on the screen and shows the options for the OptionsPane with the given title.

Parameters:
title - the title of the OptionsPane to be displayed
See Also:
OptionsPane, OptionsWindow
